entry.title: An Anyon Superconducting Groundstate in Si MOSFETS?
entry.summary: This is a comment on a paper published by V. Dobrosavljevic et al. in Phys. Rev. Lett. 79, 455 (1997).

entry.title: Bosonization Redux
entry.summary: Paper has been withdrawn for major repairs.
entry.arxiv:comment: Paper has been withdrawn for major repairs

entry.title: Reply to Comments "T Dependence of the Magnetic Penetration Depth in Unconventional Superconductors..."
entry.summary: We reply to the criticism raised by Volovik in his Comment (cond-mat/9805159) and by Hirschfeld et al. in their Comment (cond-mat/9806085).

entry.title: Nonlocal electrical conductivity coefficient sigma sub-k
entry.summary: A nonlocal functional is used to calculate superconducting properties of barium yttrium copper oxide.

entry.title: Comment on "Mesoscopic Superconducting-Normal Metal-Superconducting Transistor"
entry.summary: Comment withdrawn. To be superseded by a subseqent paper.

entry.title: Reply to: --- Interlayer Josephson vortices in the high-T_c superconducting cuprates
entry.summary: Here we reply to Farid's comment.

author.name: John. R. Kirtley
author.arxiv:affiliation: IBM T.J. Watson Research Center, NY

entry.title: Cuprates: experiment vs. quasiparticle theory
entry.summary: Comment on the view of P.W. Anderson on the cuprates, as expressed in the Feb. '00 issue of Physics Today.

entry.title: withdrawn
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to new experimental results.

entry.title: Turning insulators into superconductors
entry.summary: The recent observation by Batlogg and colleagues of superconductivity in an organic field-effect transistor is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Unabridged version of a recent News and Views in Nature

entry.title: Note on the Spin-Spin Relaxation Time in High-Tc Cuprate Superconductors
entry.summary: Recent experiments on the spin-spin relaxation time in high-Tc cuprate superconductors are discussed on the basis of the BCS-RPA theory.

entry.title: Some comments on superconductivity in diborides
entry.summary: Short discussion trying to explain, why superconductivity revealed for some diborides is not always confirmed in experiments of different research groups.

entry.title: Criticality versus q in the 2+1-dimensional $Z_q$ clock model
entry.summary: Paper has been withdrawn, see comment.
entry.arxiv:comment: Paper has been withdrawn; see cond-mat/0301499

entry.title: Heating-free I-V of the `intrinsic' Josephson effect
entry.summary: I present arguments favouring linearity of the intrinsic (heating-free) I-V of the `intrinsic' Josephson effect.
entry.arxiv:comment: auxillary to cond-mat/0306081; addresses conclusions of cond-mat/0309132 and cond-mat/0309131

entry.title: Collective modes of single hyperfine state Fermi gases in optical lattices
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author since it contains errors.

entry.title: Reply to a comment "No robust phases in aerogel..." (cond-mat/0505281)
entry.summary: The arguments of Volovik are refuted.

entry.title: Superconductor-Metal-Insulator Crossover in Disordered Thin Films
entry.summary: Superconductor-Metal-Insulator crossover in disordered thin films is discussed on the basis of a random junction-network model.

entry.title: Comment on "Solution of the problem of catastrophic relaxation of homogenious spin precession in superfluid 3He-B"
entry.summary: The argument of Bunkov, L`vov and Volovik contains errors, making the obtained result non-convincing.

entry.title: Local stability conditions for asymmetric Fermi superfluid
entry.summary: Two different local stability conditions for an asymmetric superfluid has been discussed in the literature. We here consider the relations between them.

entry.title: Comment on "Classifying Novel Phases of Spinor Atoms"
entry.summary: Comment on "Classifying Novel Phases of Spinor Atoms", Phys. Rev. Lett. 97, 180412 (2006) by R. Barnett, A. Turner and E. Demler

entry.title: Comment on "Spatial line nodes and fractional vortex pairs in the Fulde-Ferrell-Larkin-Ovchinnikov phase"
entry.summary: This is a Comment on Phys.Rev.Lett. 100, 017001 (2008).

entry.title: High temperature superconductivity: from complexity to simplicity
entry.summary: I discuss the recent quantum oscillation experiments in the underdoped high temperature superconductors.
entry.arxiv:comment: An edited shorter version is published in Science

entry.title: A brief comment on the chemical formulae of the rare earth iron arsenide oxide superconductors
entry.summary: Just a brief comment on the chemical formulae of the rare earth iron arsenide oxide superconductors

entry.title: Materials with ZrCuSiAs Type Structure
entry.summary: The crystal chemistry and physical properties of materials with ZrCuSiAs type structure is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 32 pages, 1 figure. Z. Naturforsch. B, submitted

entry.title: To the methodics of the superconducting nanotube paraconductivity calculation
entry.summary: In the investigation carried out, the superconducting nanotube paraconductivity calculation algorithm is defined more precisely.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 0 figures. Submitted to the Izvestiya VUZov. Fizika (Russian Physics Journal)

entry.title: Response to Comment by A. Bussmann-Holder (arXiv:0909.3603)
entry.summary: Response to Comment by A. Bussmann-Holder (arXiv:0909.3603)

entry.title: Pairing mechanism for high temperature superconductivity in the cuprates: what can we learn from the two-dimensional t-J model?
entry.summary: A possible pairing mechanism for high temperature superconductivity in the cuprates is discussed.

entry.title: Reply to Comment on "Nonmagnetic Impurity Resonances as a Signature of Sign-Reversal Pairing in FeAs-based Superconductors"
entry.summary: This is a reply to the comment by Daghofer and Moreo.

entry.title: Ward Identities for Cooper Pairs
entry.summary: Ward identities for Cooper pairs are derived. These give consistent description of electronic curent vertex and thermal current vertex.

entry.title: Ward identities for anisotropic Cooper pairs
entry.summary: Ward identities for anisotropic Cooper pairs are derived. These for nonlocal pairs have the same form as those for local pairs by employing the pair propagator with the form factor.

entry.title: Ward identities for particle-particle and particle-hole pairs
entry.summary: Ward identities for charge-density and spin-density fluctuations are discussed in comparison with those for superconducting fluctuations.

entry.title: TDGL Equations for Two-Band Superconductor
entry.summary: Green's function techniques for studying nonequilibrium processes in two-band superconductor are discussed. Perturbation expansions and Green's function equations are developed. A time dependent modification of the Ginsburg-Landau equation is given.

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on `Fluctuation-induced first-order transition in p-wave superconductors'"
entry.summary: This is a Reply to the Comment posted as arXiv:1207.1261.

entry.title: Ward identities for extended objects
entry.summary: Ward identities for extended objects are discussed. In the limit of dc transport it is rigorously proved that charge-density and spin-density fluctuations do not couple to electromagnetic field.

entry.title: Advanced superconducting circuits and devices
entry.summary: Short review on advanced superconducting circuits and devices.
entry.arxiv:comment: To be published in 'Handbook of Applied Superconductivity', Wiley-VCH

entry.title: Pseudogap and the chemical potential position topology in multiband superconductors
entry.summary: Original definition of the pseudogap [11,12] allowes to connect it conceptually with a topological insulator. It concerns the multiband superconductivity background with variable chemical potential position.

entry.title: Pseudospin bases for a model of Cu:Bi$_2$Se$_3$
entry.summary: We consider the construction of pseudospin bases for a time-reversal and inversion symmetric system, illustrated by a model for Cu:Bi$_2$Se$_3$. Different methods and bases are compared.

entry.title: Fluctuations in the Lattice Ginzburg-Landau model
entry.summary: Temporarly withdrawn. Larger version of this review is currently in preparation.
entry.arxiv:comment: Temporarily withdrawn. larger version of this review is currently in preparation

entry.title: Reply to the comment by D.N. Aristov and A.G. Yashenkin
entry.summary: Reply to the comment by D.N. Aristov and A.G. Yashenkin (cond-mat/9612245) on PRL by Balatsky and Salkola (Phys. Rev. Lett., V76, 2386, (1996), cond-mat/9602034).

entry.title: Josephson Plasma Resonance in High Temperature Superconductors: A Test of Interlayer Tunneling Theory
entry.summary: Josephson plasma frequency is computed within the interlayer tunneling theory and compared against the experimental results in Tl_2Ba_2CuO_y and La_{2-x}Sr_xCuO_4. It is shown that the theoretical estimates are fully consistent with the recent experiments.

entry.title: Exactly Solvable Model of Superconducting Magnetic Alloys
entry.summary: A model describing the Anderson impurity in the Bardeen-Cooper-Schriffer superconductor is proven to exhibit hidden integrability and is diagonalized exactly by the Bethe ansatz.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, RevTEX, Phys. Lett. A. (in press)

entry.title: Magnetic Penetration Depth in a Superconductor
entry.summary: It is shown that the notion of the finite pairing interaction energy range $T_d$ results in a linear temperature dependence of the London magnetic penetration depth $\Delta \lambda / \lambda (0) = (T/T_d)(2/\pi)\ln 2$ at low temperature, in the case of the s-wave pairing state.

entry.title: Resistance of Layered Superclean Superconductors at Low Temperatures
entry.summary: The low energy excitation spectrum is found for a layered superconductor vortex with a small number of impurities inside the vortex core. All levels are found to be correlated. This leads to the strong enhancement of conductivity in superclean layered superconductors.

entry.title: Momentum density of high Tc Copper Oxydes
entry.summary: We discuss the work aimed at studying the momentum density of high Tc superconducting oxides using Compton profile and positron annihilation spectroscopies.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, Latex, 2 figures, to appear in Mat. Sci. Forum

entry.title: Domain Walls Motion and Resistivity in a Fully-Frustrated Josephson Array
entry.summary: It is identified numerically that the resistivity of a fully-frustrated Josephson-junction array is due to motion of domain walls in vortex lattice rather than to motion of single vortices.

entry.title: Comment on "Nonlocal Effects on the Magnetic Penetration Depth in d-wave Superconductors"
entry.summary: Based on the third law of thermodynamics it is shown, that the first derivative of the magnetic penetration depth with respect to temperature should vanish irrespective of the symmetry of Cooper pairs.

entry.title: On the London Free Energy and Tilt Modulus of the Flux Line Lattice in Type II Superconductors
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Intrinsic frustration effects in anisotropic superconductors
entry.summary: Lattice distortions in which the axes are locally rotated provide an intrinsic source of frustration in anisotropic superconductors. A general framework to study this effect is presented. The influence of lattice defects and phonons in $d$ and $s+d$ layered superconductors is studied.

entry.title: High Temperature Superconductivity
entry.summary: The current status of basic research on the high temperature cuprate superconductors and prospects for technological applications of these materials is discussed. Recent developments concerning other novel superconductors are also briefly described.

entry.title: On the T-dependence of the magnetic penetration depth in unconventional superconductors at low temperatures: can it be linear?
entry.summary: We present a thermodynamics argument against a strictly linear temperature dependence of the magnetic penetration depth, which applies to superconductors with arbitrary pairing symmetry at low temperatures.

entry.title: Theory of ac Josephson effect and noise in superconducting constrictions
entry.summary: The manuscript presents an overview of recent developments in theory of multiple Andreev reflections in Josephson junctions with arbitrary transparency and arbitrary quasiparticle dispersion in the electrodes.

entry.title: On the Mechanism of Superconductivity in HTSC from Tunneling Spectroscopy Measurements on Bi-2212 Single Crystals
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the author because the observed effect has a different origin.

entry.title: Electron-fluctuation interaction in a non-Fermi superconductor
entry.summary: We studied the influence of the amplitude fluctuations of a non-Fermi superconductor on the energy spectrum of the 2D Anderson non-Fermi system. The classical fluctuations give a temperature dependence in the pseudogap induced in the fermionic excitations.

entry.title: The Gradient Expansion for the Free-Energy of a Clean Superconductor
entry.summary: We describe a novel method for obtaining the gradient expansion for the free energy of a clean BCS superconductor. We present explicit results up to fourth order in the gradients of the order parameter.

entry.title: Comment on "Predominantly Superconducting Origin ...", by N. Miyakawa, et al
entry.summary: Recent tunneling studies in Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8 suggest that the pseudogap is caused by superconducting fluctuations. By reanalyzing this data, we show that instead there is a second non-superconducting component of the gap which increases strongly with underdoping.

entry.title: Interlayer Josephson vortices in the high-T_c superconducting cuprates
entry.summary: We comment on the work by Moler, et al., [Science 279, 1193 (1998)] concerning determination of the c-axis penetration depth in the single-layer compound Tl-2201 through measuring the magnetic flux due to isolated interlayer Josephson vortices.

entry.title: Reply to a Comment on "Is the nonlinear Meissner effect unobservable? (Phys. Rev. Lett. 81, 5640 (1998))" (Cond-mat/9812290)
entry.summary: We reply to a recent comment by Bhattacharya et. al. (cond-mat/9812290) on our previous Letter (PRL 81, 5640 (1998)).

entry.title: Topological Aspects Of Spin Pairing in High $T_c$ Superconductivity and Berry Phase
entry.summary: From topological viewpoint we have analysed the role of Berry phase in spin pairing mechanism of high $T_c$ superconducting state.

entry.title: Q-Factor Measurement of Nonlinear Superconducting Resonators
entry.summary: A novel method, which combined a multi-bandwidth measurement and an extrapolation procedure, is proposed for extracting the loaded Q-factor (Q_{L}) with improved accuracy from non-Lorentzian resonances of nonlinear superconducting resonators.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 4 figures, to appear in Electronics Letters

entry.title: Pinhole model for the Josephson pi state in 3He
entry.summary: This Master's Thesis presents some new quasiclassical calculations of the Josephson pi state in 3He-B weak links.

entry.title: Ando, Lavrov, and Segawa Reply
entry.summary: Authors' Reply to the Comment by Janossy et al. [cond-mat/0005275] on our article, "Magnetoresistance Anomalies in Antiferromagnetic YBa_{2}Cu_{3}O_{6+x}: Fingerprints of Charged Stripes" [cond-mat/9905071, Phys. Rev. Lett. 83, 2813 (1999)].
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page, 1 figure, accepted for publication in PRL

entry.title: Vibrational Density of States in Superconducting MgB$_2$
entry.summary: This paper is withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Absence of Superconductivity in BeB2
entry.summary: The hexagonal BeB2 compound has been prepared and found to be paramagnetic down to 5 K. The mixed (Mg,Be)B2 system has the same TC =39 K as pure MgB2, indicating that Be does not replace the Mg atoms.

entry.title: Metallic Xenon, Molecular Condensates, and Superconductivity
entry.summary: A possibility of explaining the light absorption observed to occur under pressure-induced xenon metallization as due to the transition to the superconducting state is analyzed. The mechanism of the van der Waals bonding is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX 2.09 (RevTeX), 4 pages, 4 PostScript figures included in text

entry.title: Two-band model and MgB$_2$ superconductivity
entry.summary: A simple two-band model with interband scattering of intraband pairs is applied to MgB$_2$ superconductivity. An adjustable parameters set is chosen. The calculated $T_c$ vs doping, isotope exponent and the heat capacity jump are in qualitative agreement with the observations.

entry.title: RVB Revisited
entry.summary: We propose that early speculations on the nature of the normal state of the $CuO_2$ planes in high $T_c$ superconductors can be revised and brought into agreement with more modern theories, simulations and experimental observations.
entry.arxiv:comment: latex file 5 pages. Original paper writeen in 1999. Late submission due to clerical error

entry.title: Effect of Disorder on a D-wave Superconductor
entry.summary: We apply the Coherent Potential Approximation (CPA) to an extended Hubbard model to describe disordered superconductors with d-wave pairing. We discuss the pair-breaking effect caused by non-magneticdisorder in presence of Van Hove Singularity.

entry.title: Comment on ``Critical current density from magnetization hysteresis data using the critical-state model''
entry.summary: A recent paper [Physical Review {\bf B 64} 014508 (2001)] claims to present an exact method to extract the critical current density J$_C$ from the M-H hysteresis curve. We show that this claim appears unjustified.

entry.title: Two Pseudogaps in the Cuprates
entry.summary: Meingast, et al. suggest that in YBCO the pseudogap is associated with preformed pairs. It is shown that in underdoped cuprates there is evidence for two pseudogaps, and superconducting fluctions terminate at the smaller pseudogap.

entry.title: 2D superconductivity with strong spin-orbit interaction
entry.summary: We consider superconductivity confined at a two-dimensional interface with a strong surface spin-orbit (Rashba) interaction. Some peculiar properties of this system are investigated. In particular, we show that an in-plane Zeeman field can induce a supercurrent flow.

entry.title: The Race to Beat the Cuprates
entry.summary: Recent results reported in Science by Schon et al. using field-effect doping to study ladders and fullerenes are here described.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 2 color figures, important new references added, problems with figures corrected

entry.title: Modified BCS mechanism of Cooper pair formation in narrow energy bands of special symmetry III. Physical interpretation
entry.summary: In Part I of this paper a modified BCS mechanism of Cooper pair formation was proposed. The present Part III gives a physical interpretation of this mechanism in terms of spin-flipping processes in superconducting bands.

entry.title: Intercalation and High Temperature Superconductivity of Fullerides II
entry.summary: Based on the mechanism described by the authors in cond-mat/0109553, we predict that the compound C60/CHI3 will have Tc~140K, which would be the highest value obtained sofar for intercalated materials.

entry.title: Dominant mode in the cuprates: electronic vs. phononic scenario
entry.summary: We make the case for an electronic origin of the strong mode, recently seen in ARPES experiments, and, in this regard, further discuss the physics of the spin resonance peak.

entry.title: Current Distribution for Superconducting Strip Transmission Lines at Microwave Frequencies
entry.summary: Current distribution for a thin superconducting strip shielded by two ideally conducting plains has been calculated. It is shown that at microwave requencies the current density has maximum over the center of the strip in contrast to the dc current pattern, which exhibits crowding over the edges.

entry.title: Paramagnetic Meissner effect in MgB2 superconductor
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn because subsequent measurements produced results not always consistent with the ones presented in the paper.

entry.title: Comment on cond-mat/0107336 ``Critical State Theory for Nonparallel Flux Line Lattices in Type-II Superconductors''
entry.summary: Comment on the paper "Critical State Theory for Nonparallel Flux Line Lattices in Type-II Superconductors" by A. Badia and C. Lopez is presented here.

entry.title: Nonadiabatic high-$T_c$ superconductivity in FET doped fullerenes
entry.summary: The validity of some experimental data on which the paper was based have been questioned by the report of the Committee of the Bell Labs released on September 2002.

entry.title: Tuning order in cuprate superconductors
entry.summary: This article presents our perspective on STM measurements by Hoffman et al. (cond-mat/0201348) of the vortex lattice in BSCCO. We discuss implications of these measurements for various theories of the cuprate superconductors.

entry.title: Erratum: Effective Lorentz Force due to Small-Angle Impurity Scattering: Magnetotransport in High-$T_c$ Superconductors
entry.summary: The equations in cond-mat/0011020 and Phys. Rev, Lett. 86, 4652 (2001) are valid but a numerical estimate in the paper is incorrect.
entry.arxiv:comment: An erratum for cond-mat/0011020 and Phys. Rev, Lett. 86, 4652 (2001)

entry.title: Pair condensation and inter-layer coupling: the role charging energy
entry.summary: this article has been withdrawn

entry.title: Growth of superconducting MgB2 thin films
entry.summary: This is the first review on superconducting MgB2 thin films as far as we know.
entry.arxiv:comment: 34 pages, 16 figures, 6 tables. Studies of high temperature superconductors, in press. Previous versions of this paper had font display problems

entry.title: Field induced helical phase in surface superconductors
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to the heavy reliance on the fraudulent experiments of Schoen. Note that part of the paper has been published in D.F. Agterberg, Physica C 387, 13 (2003).

entry.title: Communicating Josephson Qubits
entry.summary: We propose a scheme to implement a quantum information transfer protocol with a superconducting circuit and Josephson charge qubits. The information exchange is mediated by an L-C resonator used as a data bus. The main decoherence sources are analyzed in detail.

entry.title: Fluctuation-induced electric and thermal magnetotransport of superconductors in the quasiballistic regime
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s),

entry.title: Dynamics of two-dimensional Josephson junction arrays
entry.summary: No abstract. It's a review article beginning with introduction.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Studies of High Temperature Superconductors, Nova Science Publishers Inc., New York, Vol 43 (2002), Ch.5

entry.title: Magnus Force in High Temperature Superconductivity and Berry Phase
entry.summary: In the topological framework of high temperature superconductivity we have discussed the Magnus force acting on its vortices.

entry.title: Growth of Orthorhombic Tl-2201 Single Crystals by the Self-Flux Method
entry.summary: This article's content has now been absorbed into cond-mat/0609250, which supercedes it.

entry.title: Comment on "Correlation of Tunneling Spectra in Bi2212 with the Resonance Spin Excitation"
entry.summary: The interpretation of tunneling data in a recent Letter by Zasadzinski et al. is incorrect.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page (in v.2, information on Tl2201 is added)

entry.title: Simple model of anisotropic pairing with repulsive interactions
entry.summary: A simple tight binding model with repulsive interactions is studied. The inclusion of more than one orbital per site leads to assisted hopping effects, and, when the orbitals involved have different symmetries, to an anisotropic superconducting phase. Superconductivity exists for all fillings, and for all values of the on site repulsion.

entry.title: Fractal vortex structure in the lattice model of superconductors
entry.summary: The problem of the vortex structure in the lattice modele of superconductors has been reduced to the nonlinear map problem characteristic for the fractal theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, no figures, submitted for publication in Technical Physics Letters (St. Petersburg)

entry.title: Study of pinning at 3D-2D phase transition in vortex matter of strongly anisotropic high-temperature superconductors of BiPbSrCaCuO system
entry.summary: Sharp increase of pinning force was observed at the 3D-2D phase transition in strongly anisotropic high temperature superconductors of the BiPbSrCaCuO system.

entry.title: Interaction of superconductor quantum fluid with gravity field
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to an error in the treatment of the earth acceleration in the accelerated frame of the Cooper pairs

entry.title: Study of dissipation processes in high-temperature superconductors of ErBa2Cu3O7-δ system near the superconductive transition critical temperature Tc in the range of possible Abrikosov vortex lattice melting
entry.summary: Abrikosov vortex melting in high-temperature superconductors of ErBa2Cu3O7-δ system is investigated using mechanical contactless method of energy dissipation.

entry.title: Collective transport and optical absorption near the stripe criticality
entry.summary: Within the stripe quantum critical point scenario for high $T_c$ superconductors, we point out the possible direct contribution of charge collective fluctuations to the optical absorption and to the d.c. resistivity.

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on London theory for superconducting phase transitions in external magnetic fields: Application to UPt_3"
entry.summary: A reply to a comment by Mineev and Champel.

entry.title: A Two dimensional Model of Superconductivity
entry.summary: We present a two dimensional model of superconductivity where bosonization of fermions is described by topological fermion-boson duality. The model solves the discrepancy between theoretical and empirical values of penetration depth and explains the appearence of quantized vortex lines in supercunductors in accord with cyclotron motion of supercunducting electrons.

entry.title: Proximity and Josephson effects in superconducting hybrid structures
entry.summary: Chapter 1: Superconductivity in thin SN bilayers. Chapter 2: Proximity effect in SF systems. Chapter 3: Josephson effect in SFS junctions. Chapter 4: Decoherence due to nodal quasiparticles in d-wave Josephson junctions.
entry.arxiv:comment: PhD thesis. 142 pages, 37 figures, LaTeX. Hardcopies are available upon request to fominov@landau.ac.ru

entry.title: Coexistence and Competition of Isotropic Superconductivity and Itinerant Antiferromagnetism
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by the authors due to the belated discovery of a published paper showing similar results.

entry.title: Stability of power-law cable-in-conduit superconductors
entry.summary: The stability properties of cable-in-conduit superconductors with a power-law voltage-current characteristic are investigated using a previously developed model description for the take-off properties of these conductors.

entry.title: Growth and Properties of Superconducting MgB2 Thin Films
entry.summary: This review article describes the developments over the last 30 months in the thin film growth and junction fabrication of superconducting MgB2, including a brief summary the chemistry and physics of MgB2.

entry.title: Effect of Al doping on the two-gap superconductivity in MgB2 single crystals
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to obtaining a new set of tranport data.

entry.title: Nonlinearity of the field induced by a rotating superconducting shell
entry.summary: For a thin superconducting shell with cylindrical symmetry, the magnetic field generated by its rotation is easily evaluated in the Ginzburg-Landau framework. We compare this field with the result that is obtained by using the London theory.

entry.title: Lessons from vortex dynamics in super media
entry.summary: Some aspects of vortex dynamics theories are critically examined. The discussion is placed in the context of experiments on the Josephson-Anderson effect and on the Hall anomaly in the mixed state.

entry.title: Anomalous Peaks in the Fourier Transformed Density of States of a Bilayer D-Wave Superconductor
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to a sign error in the equation for F_11 which invalidates many results.

entry.title: Helium-Three in Aerogel
entry.summary: Liquid 3He confined in silica aerogel provides us with a unique system to study the effects of quenched disorder on the properties of a strongly correlated quantum liquid. The superfluid phases display interplay between disorder and complex symmetry-breaking.

entry.title: Curie and Neel Temperatures of Quantum Magnets
entry.summary: We estimate, using high-temperature series expansions, the transition temperatures of the spin 1/2, 1 and 3/2 Heisenberg ferromagnet and antiferromagnet in 3-dimensions. The manner in which the difference between Curie and Neel temperatures vanishes with increasing spin quantum number is investigated.

entry.title: Crystalline electron pairs
entry.summary: This is a nontechnical Perspective Commentary on the recent developments in cuprate STM and their ramifications for the theories of the pseudogap state, focusing on the paper by Hanaguri et al. [Nature 430, 1001 (2004)].
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, 1 figure. For related work and info visit http://www.physics.ubc.ca/~franz/

entry.title: News and expectations in Thermostatistics
entry.summary: Editorial of the International Conference (NEXT 2003): News and expectations in Thermostatistics, Sardinia 21-28 Sept. 2003

entry.title: Implications of the universal scaling relation in high-temperature superconductors
entry.summary: The recently discovered universal scaling relation between the superconducting density and the transition temperature in high-temperature superconductors appears to indicate that those normal state carriers that are undergoing a superconducting transition at T = Tc, are experiencing critical dissipation and acting as preformed pairs.

entry.title: Neutron Scattering by Superfluid He II about Dispersion Minimum
entry.summary: We derive the structure factor for superfluid He II about the energy dispersion minimum 1.93 1/A.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, no figure. Augmented reference list

entry.title: Comment on "Order parameter of A-like 3He phase in aerogel"
entry.summary: We argue that the inhomogeneous A-phase in aerogel is energetically more preferable than the "robust" phase suggested by I. A. Fomin, JETP Lett. 77, 240 (2003); cond-mat/0302117 and cond-mat/0401639.

entry.title: Superconducting protons in metals
entry.summary: The hitherto neglected phonon-exchange interaction between interstitial protons in metal lattices is found to be large. It is shown that this effect may give rise to a phase of protonic superconductivity, characterized by the formation of Cooper-like pairs of protons, in certain metals at high stoichiometric loading.

entry.title: NMR relaxation rate in non-centrosymmetric superconductors
entry.summary: The spin-lattice relaxation rate of nuclear magnetic resonance in a clean superconductor without inversion center is calculated for arbitrary pairing symmetry and band structure, in the presence of strong spin-orbit coupling.

entry.title: Glass transition and the replica symmetry breaking of vortex matter
entry.summary: Withdrawn by the authors due to submitting policy required by some journals.

entry.title: Reply to comment on PRL 85, 2368 (2000) by Prokof'ev and Svistunov
entry.summary: A short Reply to the Comment of Prokof'ev and Svistunov, cond-mat/0504008, is given.

entry.title: Differences between application of some basic principles of quantum mechanics on atomic and mesoscopic levels
entry.summary: Formalism of the quantum mechanics developed for microscopic (atomic) level comes into collision with some logical difficulties on mesoscopic level. Some fundamental differences between application of its basic principles on microscopic and mesoscopic levels are accentuated.

entry.title: Determination of vortex characteristics of YBa$_2$Cu$_3$O$_{7-}$ thin films with two different assumptions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Superconducting Quantum Circuits, Qubits and Computing
entry.summary: This paper gives an introduction to the physics and principles of operation of quantized superconducting electrical circuits for quantum information processing.
entry.arxiv:comment: 59 pages 68 figures. Prepared for Handbook of Theoretical and Computational Nanotechnology

entry.title: Details of the photoemission spectra analysis
entry.summary: Here we present some details of the self-consistent procedure of the photoemission spectra analysis suggested in [Phys. Rev. B 71, 214513 (2005); cond-mat/0405696; cond-mat/0409483] and answer some of the most frequently asked questions concerning this analysis.

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on "Domain Structure in a Superconducting Ferromagnet""
entry.summary: This short article is a reply to the comment from E.B. Sonin on our paper on the domain structure in a superconducting ferromagnet published in Phys. Rev. Lett..
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page, accepted for publication in Phys. Rev. Lett

entry.title: Josephson effect in a weak link between borocarbides
entry.summary: A stationary Josephson effect is analyzed theoretically for a weak link between borocarbide superconductors. It is shown that different models of the order parameter result in qualitatively different current-phase relations.

entry.title: Thermo- and gas-dynamical processes in NPPs after accidents
entry.summary: In the theory of superfluidity and superconductivity, a jump of the free energy was discovered theoretically and was naturally called a {\it zeroth-order phase transition}. We present an example of an exactly solvable problem in which such a phase transition occurs.

entry.title: Comments on the Superconductivity Solution of an Ideal Charged Boson System
entry.summary: We review the present status of the superconductivity solution for an ideal charged boson system, with suggestions for possible improvement.

entry.title: Paraconductivity and magnetoconductivity approaches to superconducting fluctuations in La1.6-xNd0.4SrxCuO4 films
entry.summary: This paper presents an analysis of superconducting fluctuations in the c-axis oriented La1.6-xNd0.4SrxCuO4 films by the paraconductivity and magnetoconductivity approaches.

entry.title: Chain-driven superconductivity of copper oxide identified by nuclear resonance
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to time-consuming revision.

entry.title: Josephson effect in thin films: the role of vortex excitations
entry.summary: The paper contains an error in Eqs. (14) and (15) and has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Do superconductors violate Lenz's law? Mixed and intermediate states
entry.summary: This paper has been temporarily withdrawn by the author because there are errors in it that require further study.

entry.title: Comment: In situ Measurement of Self-Heating in Intrinsic Tunneling Spectroscopy [PRL 94, 077003 (2005)]
entry.summary: Our comprehensive analysis suggests the heating origin of key findings by the authors of the commented letter, hence rendering irrelevant their conclusions.
entry.arxiv:comment: comment on PRL 94, 077003 (2005), under consideration in Phys.Rev.Lett since 22 of August 2005

entry.title: Gravitomagnetic London Moment in Rotating Supersolid $He^4$
entry.summary: Non classical rotational inertia observed in rotating supersolid $He^4$ can be accounted for by a gravitomagnetic London moment similar to the one recently reported in rotating superconductive rings.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, 1 figure, submitted to Physica C

entry.title: On the spin susceptibility of noncentrosymmetric superconductors
entry.summary: We calculate the spin susceptibility of a superconductor without inversion symmetry, both in the clean and disordered cases. The susceptibility has a large residual value at zero temperature, which is further enhanced in the presence of scalar impurities.

entry.title: Cracking the Supersolid
entry.summary: We prepresent an overview of the status of experiment and theory on the supersolid state of matter.
entry.arxiv:comment: Extended version of Science Perspective with more references

entry.title: Superconductivity in hcp Sc under pressure - linear response results and comparison with hcp Fe
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to some errors in the reported discussion, and needs a thorough revision

entry.title: Chiral d-wave superconductivity in the heavy-fermion compound CeIrIn_5
entry.summary: Recent thermal conductivity measurements in the heavy-fermion compound CeIrIn_5 indicate that its superconducting order parameter is very different from CeCoIn_5. Here we show that these experiments are consistent with chiral d-wave symmetry.
Erroneous duplicate of arXiv:0802.2617, removed by arXiv admin

entry.title: Comment on "Nonlinearity of the Field Induced by a Rotating Superconducting Shell"
entry.summary: An extension to the model from Berger is proposed to analyse the nonlinearity of the magnetic field from a rotating superconducting shell, taking into account the effect of the London penetration depth.

entry.title: Nature of Magnetic Interactions and Inelastic Neutron Scattering as a Probe of Magnetic Excitations in Iron-Pnictide Superconductors
entry.summary: This submission has been withdrawn by the arXiv admins because it is an abstract only, which is against arXiv policy.

entry.title: Ground states for three-layer hybrid superconductor
entry.summary: A superconducting hybrid structure composed of three layers is considerated.The 2D layers interact mutually by higher grade inter-layer couplings.We determine the possible superconducting modes. Those solutions enable to discuss the conditions for the onset and enhancement of 3D superconductivity in such a structure.

entry.title: Quantum statistical model for superconducting phase in graphene and nanotubes
entry.summary: A quantum statistical theory is presented, supporting a superconducting state of an ultrahigh critical temperature (1275 K) in the multiwalled nanotubes reported by Zhao and Beeli [Phys. Rev. B 77, 245433 (2008)].

entry.title: Comment on "BCS superconductivity of Dirac fermions in graphene layers"
entry.summary: Comment on "BCS superconductivity of Dirac fermions in graphene layers" by N. B. Kopnin and E. B. Sonin [arXiv:0803.3772; Phys. Rev. Lett. 100, 246808 (2008)].

entry.title: Influence of antiferromagnetic fluctuations on the pressure dependence of the critical temperature in FeSe
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn, due a wrong analysis of the obtained results.

entry.title: Onset of ATC superconductivity in Ag5Pb2O6/CuO composite
entry.summary: Meissner type superconductivity extending up to 13 - 18 degrees Celsius was confirmed in the composite material consisting of metallic particles Ag5Pb2O6 dispersed in an insulating CuO matrix, and superconductivity mechanism is based upon inter particle interaction acting in the quantum tunnelling regime.

entry.title: Reply to the comment [arXiv:0903.5110] on "Mechanism of Terahertz Electromagnetic Emission from Intrinsic Josephson Junctions" [arXiv:0810.5268]
entry.summary: We reply to the comment [arXiv:0903.5110] on our paper "Mechanism of Terahertz Electromagnetic Emission from Intrinsic Josephson Junctions" [arXiv:0810.5268].

entry.title: On supersolid fraction
entry.summary: We present an explanation of why the observed supersolid fractions of helium solids are rather far below unity. One might observe large supersolid fraction of neon systems immersing in liquid $^3$He. A system of bosonic ions in a ring trap could display a supersolid fraction close to unity.

entry.title: Temperature dependence of critical velocities and long time decay of supercurrents
entry.summary: We show that a microscopic theory of superfluidity, based on the properties of the many-body spectrum of a superfluid, can explain naturally the temperature dependence of critical velocities and the long time decay of supercurrents.

entry.title: Pair-breaking in iron-pnictides
entry.summary: The puzzling features of the slopes of the upper critical field at the critical temperature $T_c$, $H^\prime_{c2}(T_c)\propto T_c$, and of the specific heat jump $\Delta C\propto T_c^3$ of iron-pnictides are interpreted as caused by a strong pair-breaking.

entry.title: Iron pnictide superconductors: Electrons on the verge
entry.summary: An optical analysis reveals that the electronic correlations in the `parent' compounds of the iron pnictide superconductors are sufficiently strong to significantly impede the mobility of the electrons.
entry.arxiv:comment: A News and Views piece; 5 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: On Unconventional Electron Pairing In a Periodic Potential
entry.summary: On the assumption that two electrons with the same group velocity effectively attract each other a simple model Hamiltonian is proposed to question the existence of unconventional electron pairs formed by electrons in a strong periodic potential.

entry.title: Comment on "Emergence of a Superconducting State from an Antiferromagnetic Phase in Single Crystals of the Heavy Fermion Compound Ce2PdIn8"
entry.summary: Comment to D. Kaczorowski et al., Phys. Rev. Lett. 103, 027003 (2009).

entry.title: Texture and morphology of epitaxially grown LuNi2B2C thin films on single crystalline MgO substrates of different orientation
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn and will be replaced as soon as possible.

entry.title: Doubly Quantized Vortices in Bulk Ginzburg-Landau Superconductors
entry.summary: We have extended Brandt's method for accurate, efficient calculations within Ginzburg-Landau theory for periodic vortex lattices at arbitrary mean induction to lattices of "doubly quantized" vortices.

entry.title: On the interband pairing in doped graphane
entry.summary: An estimation shows that the interband pairing channel between the valence band components of doped graphane can support a superconducting transition temperature (or a contribution into this expected event) of the order of 100 K at the coupling strength near 1 eV.

entry.title: On a possibility of effective electron attraction without "a glue"
entry.summary: With the means of Schrodinger equation a two electron problem is considered. It is shown that electrons in a periodic potential might experience effective attraction without any mediating agents; which means electrons in HTSC might have effective attraction potential.

entry.title: Phenomenology of magnetically active superconductors
entry.summary: The thermodynamical phenomenological theory of magnetically active superconducting materials and magnetic-superconducting heterostructures is presented. The materials may exhibit arbitrarily strong anisotropy, parametric or structural. Exact anisotropic similarity transformations are found for both the continuum and layered hybrid systems.

entry.title: Beware of the pseudogap
entry.summary: In the pseudogap phase of a high-temperature cuprate superconductor, conflicting evidence from different experiments points to a competing state or a precursor-to-superconductivity state. One single experiment now determines that both states exist.

entry.title: Microscopic theory of type-1.5 superconductivity in multiband systems
entry.summary: We report a self-consistent microscopic theory of characteristic length scales, vortex structure and type-1.5 superconducting state in two-band systems using two-band Eilenberger formalism.

entry.title: Comment on "Giant Nernst Effect due to Fluctuating Cooper Pairs in Superconductors"
entry.summary: A comment is made on a letter (Phys. Rev. Lett. {\bf 102}, 067001) and a paper (Phys. Rev. B {\bf 83}, 020506) regarding the correct expression of the thermal current vertex for Cooper pairs.

entry.title: Cuprates - An Overview
entry.summary: A brief overview is given of the problem of high temperature superconductivity in the cuprates, with an emphasis on theoretical ideas.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lecture at 1st Centennial of Superconductivity, Cali, Columbia, June 29 - July 1, 2011

entry.title: Non-equilibrium local pair potential enhancement
entry.summary: We propose a new mechanism for the local pair potential enhancement with the help of electromagnetic control fields. The mechanism is based on the creation of non-equilibrium, spatially localized Bogoliubov quasiparticle excitations, which result in a significant enhancement of the local pair potential and the local transition temperature T_c.

entry.title: To use or not to use cool superconductors?
entry.summary: The high critical temperature and magnetic field in cuprates and Fe-based superconductors are not enough to assure applications at higher temperatures. Making these superconductors useful involves complex and expensive technologies to address many conflicting physics and materials requirements.

entry.title: Flux instabilities in type-II superconductors
entry.summary: The flux jump dynamics in the flux flow regime of type II superconductors is investigated, analytically. It is found that under some conditions flux jump avalanche may occur in a superconductor sample, which takes into account an inertial properties of the vortex matter.

entry.title: A Diagrammer's Note on Superconducting Fluctuation Transport for Beginners: I. Conductivity and Thermopower
entry.summary: A diagrammatic approach based on thermal Green function to superconducting fluctuation transport is reviewed keeping consistency with Ginzburg-Landau theory. The correct expression of the heat current vertex for Cooper pairs is clarified via Jonson-Mahan formula and Ward identities.

entry.title: Electronic structure of Pt-doped superconductor CaFe1-xPtxAs2
entry.summary: We have computed complete electronic structure of new Pt-doped superconductor CaFe1-xPtxAs2. Our findings for the parent compound of this superconductor agree well with experimental predictions.

entry.title: THz phonon spectroscopy of doped superconducting cuprates
entry.summary: Terahertz phonon spectroscopy studies of bismuth cuprates are overviewed.

entry.title: Reply to the Comment on "Unified Formulism of Andreev Reflection at a Ferromagnetic/Superconductor Interface" by Eschrig et al
entry.summary: Reply to the Comment on "Unified Formulism of Andreev Reflection at a Ferromagnetic/Superconductor Interface" by Eschrig et al

entry.title: Possibility of superconducting gap increase in heterogeneous superconductors
entry.summary: A picture of pair scattering on Wigner crystal islands for the earlier proposed superconducting state in BCS superconductor with characteristic HTSC properties is presented. The model is supposed to be valid for thin heterogeneous films and boundaries between superconductors.

entry.title: Experimental Study on the Conditions for Observing the Josephson Effect as a Method for Finding the Right Theory of Superconductivity
entry.summary: The article suggests an experiment enabling to find the right theory of superconductivity.

entry.title: Geometrical Probability Distribution Functions for Cable-in-Conduit Conductors with Simply and Multiply Connected Cross-Sections
entry.summary: A geometrical method is presented for the calculation of the strand distribution functions for cable-in-conduit superconductors with simple and multiply connected cross-sections. The method is illustrated on different cable designs with simply and multiply connected structures.

entry.title: Quantum Materials: Shape Resonances in Superstripes
entry.summary: The significance of stripes in certain high-temperature superconductors has been hotly debated for decades. Now a consensus is emerging that there may, in fact, be two networks of different stripes in which shape resonances play a key role in the superconductivity.

entry.title: A Note on the Calculation of Averages in Superconducting Cable-in-Conduit Conductors
entry.summary: We show that there are two different ways of calculating the average electric field of a superconducting cable in conduit conductor depending on the relation between the current transfer length and the characteristic self-field length.

entry.title: Kinetic Equations for a Dirty Two-Band Superconductor
entry.summary: Green function techniques for studying nonequilibrium processes in dirty two-band superconductors are discussed. Perturbation expansions and Green function equations are developed. A time dependent modification of the Usadel equation is given.

entry.title: Changing the type of superconductivity by magnetic and potential scattering
entry.summary: By evaluating the upper and thermodynamic critical fields, $H_{c2}$ and $H_c$, and their ratio $H_{c2}/H_c $ at arbitrary temperatures, we argue that situations are possible when a type-II material is transformed to type-I by adding magnetic impurities.

entry.title: Superconducting state in Fe-based materials and spin-fluctuation theory of pairing
entry.summary: Short review of the spin-fluctuation theory of superconductive pairing in iron-based pnictides and chalcogenides.
entry.arxiv:comment: English translation of publication in Russian: Uspekhi Fizicheskikh Nauk 184 (8), 882-888 (2014), DOI: 10.3367/UFNr.0184.201408h.0882

entry.title: Transport and Boundary Scattering in Confined Geometries: Analytical Results
entry.summary: We utilize a geometric argument to determine the effects of boundary scattering on the carrier mean-free path in samples of various cross sections. Analytic expressions for samples with rectangular and circular cross sections are obtained. We also outline a method for incorporating these results into calculations of the thermal conductivity.

entry.title: Generalized London free energy for high-$T_c$ vortex lattices
entry.summary: We generalize the London free energy to include four-fold anisotropies which could arise from d-wave pairing or other sources in a tetragonal material. We use this simple model to study vortex lattice structure and discuss neutron scattering, STM, Bitter decoration and $\mu$SR experiments.
entry.arxiv:comment: REVTeX, 4 pages, 2 .ps figures included, submitted to PRL

entry.title: Logarithmic divergence of normal state resistivity of bipolaronic high-$T_{c}$ cuprates
entry.summary: The resonance Wigner scattering of charged bosons (small bipolarons) in a random potential leads to logarithmically divergent low-temperature resistivity as observed in several cuprates. Unusual temperature dependence of resistivity of $La_{2-x}Sr_{x}CuO_{4}$ as well as of the Hall effect is quantitatively described in a wide temperature range providing an evidence for $2e$ charged Bose-liquid in high-$T_{c}$ cuprates.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, Latex, 3 figures available upon request

entry.title: Superconductivity in the three-leg Hubbard ladder: a Quantum Monte Carlo study
entry.summary: Quantum Monte Carlo method is used to look into the superconductivity in the three-leg Hubbard ladder. The enhanced correlation for the pairing across the central and edge chains, which has been predicted in the weak-coupling renormalization as an effect of coexistence of gapful and gapless spin modes, is here shown to persist for intermediate interaction strengths.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, RevTeX, 3 figures in PostScript files

entry.title: Fractional vortices on grain boundaries --- the case for broken time reversal symmetry in high temperature superconductors
entry.summary: We discuss the problem of broken time reversal symmetry near grain boundaries in a d-wave superconductor based on a Ginzburg-Landau theory. It is shown that such a state can lead to fractional vortices on the grain boundary. Both analytical and numerical results show the structure of this type of state.

entry.title: Strong coupling theory of impure superconductors : real space formalism
entry.summary: In the electron-phonon model, the influence of nonmagnetic impurities on the transition temperature of superconductors is revisited. Anderson's pairing condition between time-reversed eigenstate pairs is derived from the physical constraint of the Anomalous Green's function. After this pairing condition is incorporated into the self-consistency equation, one may find that the phonon-mediated interaction decreases exponentially by localization.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, Plain Tex, no figures, Appeared in Mod. Phys. Lett. B. (1996)

entry.title: Random Matrix Model for Superconductors in a Magnetic Field
entry.summary: We introduce a random matrix ensemble for bulk type-II superconductors in the mixed state and determine the single-particle excitation spectrum using random matrix theory. The results are compared with planar tunnel junction experiments in PbBi thin films. More low energy states appear than in the Abrikosov-Gor'kov-Maki or Ginzburg-Landau descriptions, consistent with observations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 postscript figure, to appear in Phys. Rev. Lett

entry.title: The Critical Temperature of an Anisotropic Superconductor in the Presence of a Homogeneous Magnetic Field and Impurities
entry.summary: The effect of a homogeneous magnetic field and nonmagnetic impurities on the critical temperature of an anisotropic superconductor has been investigated. The role of these pair-breakers in relation to the anisotropy of the order parameter is clarified.

entry.title: The magnetic susceptibility of the t-J model at low hole doping
entry.summary: We compute the dynamical magnetic susceptibility of the t-J model in its commensurate flux phase at low hole doping. We compare the calculations with experiments and exact diagonalization studies.

entry.title: A Constraint on the Anomalous Green's Function
entry.summary: It is shown that the physical constraint of the Anomalous Green's function gives a natural pairing condition. The resulting self-consistency equation is directly related to the BCS gap equation. Both inhomogeneous and homogeneous systems are considered to illustrate the importance of the constraint. Especially we find weak localization correction to the phonon-mediated interaction.

entry.title: Current-voltage relation for superconducting d-wave junctions
entry.summary: We calculate the current-voltage (I-V) relation for planar superconducting d-wave junctions for both arbitrary transmission of the junction and arbitrary orientation of the d-wave superconductors. The midgap states (MGS) present at interfaces/surfaces of a d-wave superconductor influence the I-V relation. In some arrangements we find considerable negative differential conductance and lower threshold voltage for non-zero current due to resonant conduction through MGS.

entry.title: Dynamical stripe correlations and the spin fluctuations in cuprate superconductors
entry.summary: It is conjectured that the anomalous spin dynamics observed in the normal state of cuprate superconductors might find its origin in a nearly ordered spin system which is kept in motion by thermally meandering charged domain walls. `Temperature sets the scale' finds a natural explanation, while a crossover to a low temperature quantum domain wall fluid is implied.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages Revtex. To appear in Physica C

entry.title: Stripes, Non-Fermi-Liquid Behavior, and High-Tc Superconductivity
entry.summary: The electronic structure of the high-Tc cuprates is studied in terms of "large-U" and "small-U" orbitals. A striped structure and three types of quasiparticles are obtained, polaron-like "stripons" carrying charge, "svivons" carrying spin, and "quasielectrons" carrying both. The anomalous properties are explained, and specifically the behavior of the resistivity, Hall constant, and thermoelectric power. High-temperature superconductivity results from transitions between pair states of quasielectrons and stripons.

entry.title: The Ward identity and nonadiabatic corrections to the quasiparticle self-energy
entry.summary: In some newly discovered materials the ratio of phonon to electron energies is no longer small. We have investigated the basement of the recently proposed gauge-invariant self-consistent method and found conditions of its applicability.

author.name: O. V. Danylenko
author.arxiv:affiliation: I. E. Tamm Theoretical Department, P. N. Lebedev Physical Institute, Moscow, Russia

author.name: O. V. Dolgov
author.arxiv:affiliation: I. E. Tamm Theoretical Department, P. N. Lebedev Physical Institute, Moscow, Russia

author.name: V. V. Losyakov
author.arxiv:affiliation: I. E. Tamm Theoretical Department, P. N. Lebedev Physical Institute, Moscow, Russia

entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 3 Postscript figures, to be published in Physics Letters A

entry.title: Search for the Resonance in Two Particle Tunneling Experiments of YBCO Superconductors
entry.summary: A recent theory of the resonant neutron scattering peaks in YBCO superconductors predicts the existence of a sharp spin triplet two particle collective mode (the ``\pi resonance") in the normal state. In this paper, we propose an experiment in which the \pi resonance could be probed directly in a two particle tunneling measurement.

entry.title: The SO(5) theory of high T_c superconductivity
entry.summary: This paper gives a simple introduction to the SO(5) theory of high T_c superconductivity. Current status and relation to experiments are summarized.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited Talk presented at the International Conference on Materials and Mechanisms of Superconductivity, to be publsihed in Physica C

entry.title: Is the pi-particle responsible for the 41 meV peak in YBa_2Cu_3O_7?
entry.summary: It is argued that there is no low-energy resonance associated with the pi-operators introduced by Demler and Zhang. This implies that the Hubbard model does not possess an approximate SO(5) symmetry generated by these operators. Recent finite-size studies are re-interpreted accordingly.

entry.title: Phase oscillations between two superconducting condensates in cuprate superconductors
entry.summary: Implications of the small Fermi surface are discussed. We demonstrate that superconductivity in this system can be described in terms of two coupled condensates. The two condensates result in a collective excitation corresponding to the relative phase oscillation - a phason. We discuss the possibility of searching for this collective excitation in the dynamic resistance of the SQUID.

entry.title: Charge Fluctuations and Magnetic Inelastic Neutron Scattering in Copper-Oxide high -Tc superconductors
entry.summary: Spin subsystem of the copper oxides within the polar Jahn-Teller centers model corresponds to a singlet-triplet magnet where the local boson movement accompanied by the induced longitudinal spin fluctuations. These fluctuations determine the features of the magnetic inelastic scattering in the high-Tc cuprates.

entry.title: Langevin Simulation of Nonlocal Ginzburg-Landau Model for Superconductors in a Magnetic Field
entry.summary: We numerically investigate the phenomenological nonlocal Ginzburg-Landau Hamiltonian for two-dimensional superconductors in a strong magnetic field by Langevin equation. We obtain a regular vortex lattice which is very near to the square lattice. We calculate the structure factor and Abrikosov factor at various temperatures. We also evaluate the specific heat and obtain a cusp which indicates the melting of the vortex lattice.

entry.title: Theory of tunneling spectroscopy in superconducting Sr2RuO4
entry.summary: A theory for tunneling spectroscopy in normal metal /insulator/triplet superconductor junction is presented. We assume two kinds of non-unitary triplet superconducting states which are the most promising states for Sr$_{2}$RuO$_{4}$. The calculated conductance spectra showzero-bias peaks as well as gap structures. The existences of residual components in the spectra reflect the non-unitary properties of superconducting states.

entry.title: Comment on "Magnus Force in Superfluids and Superconductors"
entry.summary: The effective action for the Josephson junction arrays should contain the topological term, which violates the particle-hole symmetry. This term is responsible for the nonzero Magnus force acting on the vortex. The Magnus force is however small because the parameter of the particle-hole asymmetry in superconductors is small.
entry.arxiv:comment: Comment to the paper by E.B. Sonin in Phys. Rev. B 55, 485 (1997) [cond-mat/9606099], revtex file, 3 pages, no figures

entry.title: Electron-Phonon Interaction and Raman Linewidth in Superconducting Fullerides
entry.summary: We propose a microscopic theory of interaction of long wave molecular phonons with electrons in fullerides in the presence of disorder. Phonon relaxation rate and frequency renormalization are discussed. Finite electronic bandwidth reduces phonon relaxation rate at $q=0$. Electron-phonon coupling constants with molecular modes in fullerides are estimated. The results are in good agreement with photoemission experiments.

entry.title: Theoretical study of the Josephson current through a junction including ferromagnetic insulator
entry.summary: The properties of Josephson junction including a ferromagnetic insulating layer are studied theoretically. The calculated current shows the anomalous dependence on the magnitude of the exchange interaction at the interface. The Josephson junction changes from 0-junction to $\pi$-junction with the increase of the magnitude of the exchange interaction.

entry.title: Stripes, Non-Fermi-Liquid Behavior, and Two-Component Transport in the High-Tc Cuprates
entry.summary: Non-Fermi-liquid features of the high-Tc cuprates, and specifically the systematic behavior of the resistivity, Hall constant, and thermoelectric power, are shown to result from an electronic structure based on "large-U" and "small-U" orbitals, and the resulting striped structure.

entry.title: Spontaneous Magnetic Flux and Quantum Noise in a Doubly Connected Mesoscopic SND Junction
entry.summary: We consider spontaneous magnetic flux in a doubly connected s-wave/normal metal/ d-wave superconductor (SND) Josephson junction. The flux magnitude is not quantized and is determined by the parameters of the system. In an isolated system, quantum fluctuations of the superconducting phase take place, leading to quantum flux noise. The possibilities of experimental observation of the effect are discussed.

entry.title: Magnetism and spin-fluctuation induced superconductivity in ruthenates
entry.summary: This talk summarizes the results published in cond-mat/9703068 (PRL 79,733, 1997) and in cond-mat/9702168 (PR56, 2556, 1997). New results regarding c-dispersion as measered by de Haas-van Alphen, and regarding residual DOS problem, is added.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at the SNS'97 Conference, Cape Cod; 1 latex file, 1 ps figure

entry.title: Universalities in vortex transport at the melting transition
entry.summary: We consider the jump in resistance at the melting transition, which is experimentally observed to be constant, independent of magnetic field (vortex density). We present an explanation of this effect based on vortex cuttings, and universalities of the structure factor at the freezing transition (the Hansen-Verlet criterion).

entry.title: Evidence for d-wave superconductivity in the repulsive Hubbard-model
entry.summary: We perform numerical simulations of the Hubbard model using the projector Quantum Monte Carlo method. A novel approach for finite size scaling is discussed. We obtain evidence in favor of d-wave superconductivity in the repulsive Hubbard model. For U=4, $T_c$ is roughly estimated as $T_c\approx 30K$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 3 figures, 2 tables, submitted to Phys. Rev. Letters

entry.title: Tunneling Studies of Pseudogaps: a Comment
entry.summary: Recent tunneling observations of a pseudogap in Bi_2Sr_2CaCu_2O_{8+delta} are not necessarily evidence that the pseudogap is associated with superconducting fluctuations. The data are here analyzed as a competition between superconductivity and a density wave (taken as a simplified model for a striped phase).

entry.title: Time Reversal Symmetry Breaking States Near Grain Boundaries Between d-wave Superconductors
entry.summary: In this paper we study the order parameter and density of states near a grain boundary between two $d_{x^2-y^2}$ superconductors. We examine broken time reversal symmetry near the interface. In particular we show that, under suitable circumstances, time reversal symmetry must be broken even when the order parameter is purely $d_{x^2-y^2}$ everywhere in space.

entry.title: Weakly localised bosons
entry.summary: In this paper, we argue that, in 2-d, the weak localisation of bosons, which occurs on the insulating side of the superconductor-insulator transition, is characterised by $\rho \sim ln(1/T)$, as compared to $\sigma \sim lnT$ for fermions. Such an unconventional behaviour is tied to the diffusion pole of the delocalised (uncondensed) vortices.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 2 figures; accepted for publication in Physical Review B To appear in Phys. Rev. B

entry.title: Structure of an Elastic Lattice Pinned by Hopping Defects
entry.summary: The translational order in a three-dimensional lattice pinned by hopping defects is studied. It is suggested that the equilibrium state of the lattice crosses from a glass to a crystal on the rate of hopping. It is argued that such a transition may exist in flux lattices of high-temperature superconductors due to the hopping of oxygen.
entry.arxiv:comment: latex, 8 pages, 0 figures, submitted for publication

entry.title: Normal state thermodynamics of cuprate superconductors
entry.summary: We propose a microscopic explanation of the pseudogap features discovered in the normal state specific heat and magnetic susceptibility of cuprates. In the framework of the bipolaron theory of high-Tc superconductors we explain the magnitude of the carrier specific heat and susceptibility as well as their universal scaling with temperature over a wide range of doping.

entry.title: Overscreening in Hubbard electron systems
entry.summary: We show that doping-induced charge fluctuations in strongly correlated Hubbard electron systems near the 1/2-filled, insulating limit cause overscreening of the electron-electron Coulomb repulsion. The resulting attractive screened interaction potential supports d_{x^2-y^2}-pairing with a strongly peaked, doping dependent pairing strength at lower doping, followed by s-wave pairing at larger doping levels.

entry.title: Comment on "Temperature dependence of the Raman-active B_{1g} and A_{1g} modes in YNi_2B_2C"
entry.summary: Both principal conclusions of Hirata and Takeya paper (Phys. Rev. B 57, 2671 (1998)) dealing with an analysis of the electron-phonon coupling strengths and stating the existence of two boron-related fully symmetric phonon modes in YNi_2B_2C are argued not to be supported by experimental data and not justified.

entry.title: On piezophase effects in mechanically loaded atomic scale Josephson junctions
entry.summary: The response of an intrinsic Josephson contact to externally applied stress is considered within the framework of the dislocation-induced atomic scale Josephson effect. The predicted quasi-periodic (Fraunhofer-like)stress-strain and stress-current patterns should manifest themselves for experimentally accessible values of applied stresses in intrinsically defected (e.g.,twinned) crystals.

entry.title: Dynamic vortex mass in clean Fermi superfluids and superconductors
entry.summary: We calculate the dynamic vortex mass for clean Fermi superfluids including both s- and d-wave superconductors as a response to a vortex acceleration. Assuming a finite quasiparticle mean free time, the vortex mass appears to be a tensor. The diagonal component dominates in the limit of long mean free time while the off-diagonal mass takes over in the moderately clean regime.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, no figures, typeset using RevTeX

entry.title: Josephson Lattices of the Optimal Size
entry.summary: The stability of the bound states of the magnetic flux in a Josephson resistive lattices is investigated numerically. It is shown that for a simple relationship between the geometrical parameters of the lattice the range of bias current is the widest.

entry.title: Rotating Superconductors and the Frame-independent London Equation
entry.summary: A frame-independent, thermodynamically exact London equation is presented, which is especially valid for rotating superconductors. A direct result is the unexpectedly high accuracy ($\sim10^{-10}$) for the usual expression of the London moment.

entry.title: Analog of Magnetoelectric Effect in High-Tc Granular Superconductors
entry.summary: We propose the existence of an electric-field induced nonlinear magnetization in a weakly coupled granular superconductor due to time-parity violation. As the field increases the induced magnetization passes from para- to dia-magnetic behavior. We discuss conditions under which this effect could be experimentally measured in high-temperature superconductors.
entry.arxiv:comment: REVTEX (epsf style), 1 PS figure; to appear in Europhysics Letters

entry.title: Stripes Have Hair
entry.summary: It is suggested that recent experiments provide evidence for modulations along the charged stripes in the striped phase of the cuprates. Furthermore, 1/8 doping is special because it is associated with a crossover: for lower doping the magnetic stripe width changes; for higher, the hole-doped stripes grow. The crossover is reflected in the doping dependence of the spin gap.

entry.title: Energy Resolved Supercurrent between two superconductors
entry.summary: In this paper I study the energy resolved supercurrent of a junction consisting of a dirty normal metal between two superconductors. I also consider a cross geometry with two additional arms connecting the above mentioned junction with two normal reservoirs at equal and opposite voltages. The dependence of the supercurrent between the two superconductors on the applied voltages is studied.
entry.arxiv:comment: revtex, 7 pages, 8 figures. accepted by Phys. Rev. B

entry.title: Parity effect in a small superconducting grain: A rigorous result
entry.summary: The parity effect in an ultra-small superconducting grain is examined. By applying a generalized version of Lieb's spin-reflection positivity technique, we show rigorously that the parity parameter $\Delta_P$ is nonvanishing in such a system. A positive lower bound for $\Delta_P$ is derived.

entry.title: A Progress Report on the SO(5) Theory of High T_c Superconductivity
entry.summary: In this talk I give a brief update on the recent progress in the SO(5) theory of high T_c superconductivity (Science, 275: 1089,1997). Reviewed topics include SO(5) ladders, the unification of BCS and SDW quasi-particles in the SO(5) theory and the microscopic origin of the condensation energy.
entry.arxiv:comment: To be published by Springer Verlag in the Proceedings of the Grand Finale Taniguchi Symposium on "The Physics and Chemistry of Transition Metal Oxides"

entry.title: Non-Adiabatic Distortion In The Current Distribution Around A Moving Vortex
entry.summary: We study the phase distribution around a vortex in uniform motion. We consider both the cases of neutral and charged superfluids. The motion of the vortex causes the density of the system to fluctuate. This in turn produces a compensating current, thus ensuring current conservation locally. We explicitly calculate this current.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages; To Appear in Phys. Rev. B

entry.title: Realistic Surface Scattering and Surface Bound State Formation in the High T_c Superconductor YBa_2Cu_3O_{6+x}
entry.summary: Surface Umklapp scattering of quasiparticles, and surface roughness are shown to play essential roles in the formation of the surface bound states in realistic models for YBa_2Cu_3O_{6+x}. The results account for the shape, the impurity dependence of the height, and for a proposed universal width of the zero bias conductance peak.

entry.title: Subgap resonances and conduction channels in mesoscopic superconducting devices
entry.summary: Peaks associated to multiple Andreev reflections have been used to identify the number of conduction channels, and their transmitivity in mesoscopic superconducting junctions. We analyze the influence of the detailed shape of each channel, and the number of weak links within it, on the final results. Connexions with the statistical interpretation of conductance histograms is also made.

entry.title: Origin of the Hall conductivity below the vortex-lattice melting in twinned single crystal YBCO
entry.summary: In his the Comment, P. Ao affirms that his vortex many-body theory explains the observations reported in G. D'Anna et al., Phys. Rev. Lett. 81, 2530 (1998). Indeed, we provide here some arguments to show the lack of a satisfactory explanation within the known theoretical frameworks.
entry.arxiv:comment: D'Anna et al. Reply to P. Ao Comment

entry.title: Dissipation effects on the superconductor-insulator transition in 2-D superconductors
entry.summary: Results on the superconductor to insulator transition in two-dimensional films are analyzed in terms of coupling of the system to a dissipative bath. Upon lowering the temperature the parameter that controls this coupling becomes relevant and a wide range of metallic phase is recovered.

entry.title: Phase transition curves for mesoscopic superconducting samples
entry.summary: We compute the phase transition curves for mesoscopic superconductors. Special emphasis is given to the limiting shape of the curve when the magnetic flux is large. We derive an asymptotic formula for the ground state of the Schr\"odinger equation in the presence of large applied flux. The expansion is shown to be sensitive to the smoothness of the domain. The theoretical results are compared to recent experiments.

entry.title: Phonon relaxation of subgap levels in superconducting quantum point contacts
entry.summary: Superconducting quantum point contacts are known to possess two subgap states per each propagating mode. In this note we compute the low-temperature relaxation rate of the upper subgap state into the lower one with the emission of an acoustic phonon. If the reflection in the contact is small, the relaxation time may become much longer than the characteristic lifetime of a bulk quasiparticle.

entry.title: High frequency vortex dynamics and magnetoconductivity of high temperature superconductors
entry.summary: The vortex lattice with the superconducting and normal state charge carriers fractions may be regarded as three independent subsystems mutually connected by interactions. The equation of motion for these three subsystems must be solved simultaneously. In this way a new consistent theory of the vortex dynamics is obtained and the magnetoconductivity calculated.

entry.title: Anomalous Magnetothermal Resistance of High-Tc Superconductors: Anomalous Cyclotron Orbits at a Dirac Point
entry.summary: I derive equations of motion for quasiparticles near the nodes in the d-wave gap of high Tc superconductors. Previous versions have not properly taken into account the spatial dependence of the gap parameter phase. The results are compatible with magnetothermal conductivity measurements in the superconducting phase by Ong and Krishana.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 3 Figures (figures not included but hard copies available on request

entry.title: Bound States in the Vortex Core
entry.summary: The quasiparticle excitation spectrum of isolated vortices in clean layered d-wave superconductors is calculated. A large peak in the density of states in the "pancake" vortex core is found, in an agreement with the recent experimental data for high-temperature superconductors.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Latex, 2 eps figures, published in SFKM '97 Proceedings, Solid State Phenomena Vol. 61-62 (1998), p. 261-265

entry.title: Spinon Superconductivity and Superconductivities Mediated by Spin-Waves and Phonons in Cuprates
entry.summary: The disclosure of spinon superconductivity and superconductivity mediated by spin-waves in hole-doped Bi2212 cuprate raises the question about the origin of the superconductivity in other cuprates and specially in an electron-doped NCCO cuprate.

entry.title: Comment on "Is the nonlinear Meissner effect unobservable?"
entry.summary: In a recent Letter (Phys. Rev. Lett. 81, p.5640 (1998), cond-mat/9808249 v3), it was suggested that nonlocal effects may prevent observation of the nonlinear Meissner effect in YBCO. We argue that this claim is incorrect with regards to measurements of the nonlinear transverse magnetic moment, and that the most likely reason for a null result lies elsewhere.

entry.title: Tilt Grain-Boundary Effects in S- and D-Wave Superconductors
entry.summary: We calculate the s- and d-wave superconductor order parameter in the vicinity of a tilt grain boundary. We do this self-consistently within the Bogoliubov de Gennes equations, using a realistic microscopic model of the grain boundary. We present the first self-consistent calculations of supercurrent flows in such boundaries, obtaining the current-phase characteristics of grain boundaries in both s-wave and d-wave superconductors.

entry.title: Phonon assisted tunneling in Josephson junctions
entry.summary: The expression for additional subgap current in the presence of electron-phonon interaction is derived. We show that the phonon assisted tunneling leads to appearance of peaks on current-voltage characteristics at the Josephson frequencies corresponding to the Raman-active phonons. The relation of the obtained results to experimental observations are discussed.

entry.title: Paramagnetic state in d-wave Superconductors
entry.summary: We study theoretically the paramagnetic state in d-wave superconductors. We present the specific heat, the magnetization, superfluid density obtained within the weak-coupling model. At low temperatures and for small magnetic fields they exhibit simple power law behaviors, which should be accessible experimentally in hole-doped high-T_c cuprates and \kappa-(ET)_2 salts in a magnetic field within the conducting plane.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages(EuroTeX), 13 figures, submitted to Europhysics Letters

entry.title: Magnetic Ordering in Layered High Temperature Superconductors
entry.summary: We discuss the scenario of two-step magnetic ordering in layered high temperature superconductors after charge ordering. As the temperature decreases, the transition from 3D Heisenberg spin behavior to 2D XY coupling of the Cu spins occurs at Berezinskii-Kosterlitz-Thouless temperature in dielectric stripes. Further temperature decreasing leads to the 3D spin glass transition.

author.name: G. G. Sergeeva
author.arxiv:affiliation: Kharkov Institute of Physics and Technology, Kharkov, Ukraine

entry.title: Metallic Xenon. Conductivity or Superconductivity?
